module.title: TypeScript with React
module.description: Add type safety to your React applications

lessons.title: TypeScript Basics for React
Typing React Components

exercises.title: Typed Props
exercises.description: Create a component with typed props.
exercises.instructions:
Create a typed `UserProfile` component:
1. Define a `UserProfileProps` interface with:
   - name: string
   - age: number
   - isAdmin: boolean (optional)
2. Create the component using these props
3. Display name and age, and show "Admin" badge if isAdmin is true
hints: Use interface to define the prop types
Use ? after property name to make it optional
Add the type annotation after the props destructuring
exercises.validationPrompt: Check if UserProfileProps interface is defined correctly and component uses typed props

exercises.title: Typed Function
exercises.instructions:
Create a function `formatPrice` that:
1. Takes amount (number) as parameter
2. Returns a string like "$XX.XX"
3. Has proper TypeScript types
hints: Add : string before the opening brace
exercises.validationPrompt: Check if formatPrice has number param type and string return type

exercises.title: Typed Component
exercises.description: Create a fully typed React component.
exercises.instructions:
Create a typed `Badge` component:
1. Define BadgeProps interface with text (string) and color (string)
2. Component displays text in a span
3. Uses color for style
hints: Interface defines the shape of props
exercises.validationPrompt: Check if BadgeProps interface is defined with text and color strings
